name: Amazon AWS Architects, Engineers, Developers, Consultants, Entrepreneurs Experts
re:Invent
description: Annual user conference. The event features keynote announcements, training and certification opportunities, over 250 technical sessions, a partner expo, after hours activities, and more.

name: Summits
description: Global one-day events that are designed to educate new customers about the AWS platform and offer existing customers deep technical content to be more successful with AWS.

name: AWSome Day
description: Global one-day events are delivered by AWS Education's technical instructors and are ideal for IT pros, developers and technical managers who would like to learn about how to get started in the AWS Cloud.

name: Amazon Web Services in Plain English
description: Entertaining and educational, a community contribution.

name: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2)
description: Provides scalable virtual private servers using Xen.

name: Amazon EC2 Container Service (ECS)
description: Supports Docker containers on EC2 instances.

name: AWS Elastic Beanstalk
description: Provides quick deployment and management of applications in the cloud.

name: Amazon Lambda
description: Runs code in response to events and automatically manages EC2 instances.

name: Auto Scaling
description: Launches or terminates EC2 instances based on policies, schedules, and health checks.

name: Amazon Elastic Load Balancing (ELB)
description: Automatically distributes incoming traffic across multiple EC2 instances.

name: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
description: Creates a logically isolated set of EC2 instances which can be connected to an existing network using a VPN connection.

name: AWS Direct Connect
description: Provides dedicated connections to AWS for faster and cheaper data throughput.

name: Amazon Elastic Load Balancing (ELB)
description: Automatically distributes incoming traffic across multiple EC2 instances.

name: Amazon Route 53
description: Provides a highly available and scalable Domain Name System (DNS) web service.

name: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
description: Creates a logically isolated set of EC2 instances which can be connected to an existing network using a VPN connection.

name: Amazon WorkSpaces
description: Provides a cloud-based desktop experience to end-users.

name: Amazon Workspaces Application Manager (WAM)
description: Simplifies deployment and management of WorkSpaces.

name: Amazon WorkDocs
description: Provides a fully managed, secure enterprise storage and sharing service.

name: Amazon WorkMail
description: Provides managed email and calendaring service.

name: Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR)
description: Hosts a Hadoop and Spark framework running on EC2 and S3.

name: AWS Data Pipeline
description: Provides workload management by processing and moving data between services.

name: Amazon Elasticsearch Service (ES)
description: Managed Elasticsearch, a popular open-source search and analytics engine.

name: Amazon Kinesis
description: Provides real-time data processing over large, distributed data streams.

name: Amazon Kinesis Firehose
description: Captures and automatically loads streaming data into S3 and Redshift.

name: Amazon Machine Learning
description: Provides managed machine learning technology.

name: Amazon Redshift
description: Provides petabyte-scale data warehousing with columnar storage and multi-node compute.

name: Amazon Quicksight
description: Provides cloud-powered business intelligence for 1/10th the cost of traditional BI solutions.

name: Amazon CloudWatch
description: Provides monitoring for AWS cloud resources and applications, starting with EC2.

name: Amazon CloudFormation
description: Provides a file-based interface for provisioning other resources.

name: AWS CloudTrail
description: Provides logs of all activity.

name: AWS Command Line Interface (CLI)
description: Provides a CLI to manage all services.

name: AWS Config
description: Provides a detailed view of all resources.

name: AWS Management Console (AWS Console)
description: A web-based interface to manage all services.

name: AWS OpsWorks
description: Provides configuration of EC2 services using Chef.

name: AWS Service Catalog
description: AWS Service Catalog allows IT administrators to create, manage, and distribute portfolios of approved products to end users, who can then access the products they need in a personalized portal.

name: Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM)
description: An implicit service, the authentication infrastructure used to authenticate access to the various services.

name: AWS Directory Service
description: A managed service that allows you to connect your AWS resources with an existing on-premises Microsoft Active Directory or to set up a new, stand-alone directory in the AWS Cloud.

name: Amazon Inspector
description: An automated security assessment service that helps improve the security and compliance of applications deployed on AWS.

name: Amazon CloudHSM
description: Helps meet corporate, contractual and regulatory compliance requirements for data security by using dedicated Hardware Security Module (HSM) appliances within the AWS cloud.

name: AWS Key Management Service (KMS)
description: A managed service that makes it easy for you to create and control the encryption keys used to encrypt your data.

name: AWS WAF
description: A web application firewall service that monitors and manages CloudFront distributions.

name: Trusted Advisor
description: Helps you observe best practices by inspecting your environment for saving costs, improving system performance and reliability, and closing security gaps.

name: AWS IoT
description: Enables secure, bi-directional communication between internet-connected things (such as sensors, actuators, embedded devices, or smart appliances) and the AWS cloud over MQTT and HTTP.

name: AWS Mobile Hub
description: Provides an integrated console that helps you build, test, and monitor your mobile apps.

name: Amazon API Gateway
description: Service for publishing, maintaining and securing web service APIs.

name: Amazon Cognito
description: Provides user identity and data synchronization.

name: AWS Device Farm
description: App testing service for iOS, Android and Fire OS apps on physical devices.

name: Amazon Mobile Analytics
description: Service for collecting, visualizing, and understanding app usage data.

name: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS)
description: Provides a hosted multi-protocol "push" messaging for applications.

name: Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3)
description: Provides Web Service based storage.

name: Amazon CloudFront
description: A content delivery network (CDN) for distributing objects to locations near the requester.

name: Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS)
description: Provides persistent block-level storage volumes for EC2.

name: Amazon Elastic File System (EFS)
description: A file storage service for EC2 instances.

name: Amazon Glacier
description: Provides a low-cost, long-term storage option, intended for archiving data.

name: AWS Import/Export
description: Accelerates moving large amounts of data into and out of AWS using portable storage devices for transport.

name: AWS Storage Gateway
description: An iSCSI block storage virtual appliance with cloud-based backup.

name: Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS)
description: Provides a scalable database server with MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, and MariaDB support.

name: AWS Schema Conversion Tool
description: App that helps you convert your database schema from an Oracle or Microsoft SQL Server database, to an RDS MySQL DB instance or an Aurora DB cluster.

name: Amazon DynamoDB
description: Provides a scalable, low-latency NoSQL online Database Service backed by SSDs.

name: Amazon ElastiCache
description: Provides in-memory caching for web apps (Memcached, Redis).

name: Amazon Redshift
description: Provides petabyte-scale data warehousing with columnar storage and multi-node compute.

name: Amazon SimpleDB
description: Allows developers to run queries on structured data.

name: Amazon API Gateway
description: Service for publishing, maintaining and securing web service APIs.

name: Amazon AppStream
description: Flexible, low-latency streaming service for apps and games.

name: Amazon CloudSearch
description: Provides basic full-text search and indexing of textual content.

name: Amazon DevPay
description: Provides billing and account management.

name: Amazon Elastic Transcoder (ETS)
description: Provides video transcoding of S3 hosted videos.

name: Amazon Flexible Payments Service (FPS)
description: Provides an interface for micropayments.

name: Amazon Simple Email Service (SES)
description: Provides bulk and transactional email sending.

name: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS)
description: Provides a hosted multi-protocol "push" messaging for applications.

name: Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS)
description: Provides a hosted message queue for web applications.

name: Amazon Simple Workflow (SWF)
description: A workflow service for building scalable, resilient applications.

name: AWS CodeCommit
description: Hosted Git version control service.

name: AWS CodeDeploy
description: Provides automated code deployment to EC2 instances.

name: AWS CodePipeline
description: Continuous delivery service.

name: AWS Command Line Interface (CLI)
description: Provides a CLI to manage all services.

name: Amazon Fulfillment Web Service
description: Provides a programmatic web service for sellers to ship items to and from Amazon using Fulfillment by Amazon.

name: Amazon Mechanical Turk
description: Manages small units of work distributed among many persons.

name: Amazon Product Advertising API
description: Provides access to product data and electronic commerce functionality.

name: AWS Partner Network (APN)
description: Provides partners with the technical information and sales and marketing support to increase business opportunities.
